com.hortonworks.registries.storage.impl.jdbc.provider.phoenix.factory

Class PhoenixExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hortonworks.registries.storage.impl.jdbc.provider.sql.factory.AbstractQueryExecutor
      • com.hortonworks.registries.storage.impl.jdbc.provider.phoenix.factory.PhoenixExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QueryExecutor

    public class PhoenixExecutor
extends AbstractQueryExecutor
    SQL query executor for Phoenix. Phoenix doesn't support auto_increment feature, as well as JDBC's getGeneratedKeys(). In order to get over, we take a workaround to PhoenixSequenceIdQuery.getNextID() which provides issuing ID in safe way. If the value of id is null, we issue a new ID and set ID to entity. If the value of id is not null, we just use that value.
